hero.title:
AI-Agent‚ÄìOperated
Proof-of-Service Blockchain
hero.subtitle: Enable everyday users to participate in blockchain networks and earn rewards through service contributions, not capital accumulation

features.title: Why Choose COC?
features.subtitle: COC breaks the centralization trap of traditional blockchains through an innovative Proof-of-Service mechanism

pose.title: Proof-of-Service
pose.description: Earn rewards through verifiable service challenges, not capital accumulation or computational power competition

aiAgent.title: AI Agent Operations
aiAgent.description: OpenClaw-grade AI agents automate node operations, lowering technical barriers while maintaining determinism

hardware.title: Consumer Hardware Friendly
hardware.description: Home devices can compete fairly without specialized mining equipment or large capital requirements

nonPos.title: Non-PoS Incentives
nonPos.description: Fixed minimal bond, earnings tied to service contribution rather than capital amount

evmCompatible.title: EVM Compatible
evmCompatible.description: Full support for Ethereum Virtual Machine, can run Solidity smart contracts

storage.title: Decentralized Storage
storage.description: Built-in IPFS-compatible interface with data availability challenges

layer1.title: Execution Layer (EVM)
layer1.description: Processes transactions and smart contracts, maintains blockchain state

layer2.title: Consensus Layer (Pluggable)
layer2.description: Produces blocks and provides finality guarantees

layer3.title: PoSe Service Layer (Core)
layer3.description: Node registration, random challenges, score calculation, reward distribution

layer4.title: AI Agent Operations Layer
layer4.description: Automates node lifecycle management without affecting consensus determinism

nodeRoles.title: Node Roles

fullNode.title: Full Node (FN)
fullNode.description: Validates blocks and state, provides basic RPC queries

storageNode.title: Storage Node (SN)
storageNode.description: Stores historical data and snapshots, proves data availability

relayNode.title: Relay Node (RN)
relayNode.description: Improves block and transaction network propagation

nodeRoles.note: Single operators can run multiple roles and stack rewards

cta.title: Ready to Join the COC Network?
cta.subtitle: Launch your node and start earning rewards by providing network services

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.intro: COC (ChainOfClaw) is a blockchain network designed for broad, sustained node participation. We observe that:
abstract.pow: PoW systems tend to centralize around specialized hardware and cheap electricity
abstract.pos: PoS systems tend to centralize around capital and delegated operations
abstract.pose: COC introduces Proof-of-Service (PoSe): a verifiable challenge-response protocol that rewards nodes for providing measurable network services‚Äîuptime/RPC availability, data storage and availability, relay support‚Äîrather than rewarding stake ownership.

vision.title: Vision & Goals
vision.missionText:
Make decentralization practical by shifting the core participation bottleneck:
From 'buy hardware + run complex ops' ‚Üí 'run reliable node, backed by automated agent operations'

goal1.title: Permissionless Participation
goal1.desc: Anyone can run a node and earn rewards

goal2.title: Non-PoS Incentives
goal2.desc: Earnings tied to service contribution, not stake

goal5.title: Anti-Monopoly
goal5.desc: Diminishing returns and caps prevent winner-takes-all

goal6.title: AI Agent Operations Reliability
goal6.desc: AI agents reduce operational burden without sacrificing determinism

economic.title: Economic Model
economic.blockTime: Block Time Target: 1-2 sec (configurable per consensus)
economic.rationale: Rationale: maximize inclusivity; storage/relay earn extra but not mandatory
economic.bondIntro: Nodes post a small fixed bond D:
economic.bondNoPower: Bond does not increase consensus power
economic.bondNoReward: Bond does not directly increase rewards

pose.title: Proof-of-Service (PoSe) Protocol
pose.coreText: Nodes earn rewards by passing random, verifiable challenges over time. Each challenge produces an auditable receipt. Scores aggregate within an epoch.
pose.thresholdU: U pass rate ‚â• 80% to qualify for U bucket reward
pose.thresholdS: S pass rate ‚â• 70% to qualify for S bucket reward

agent.title: AI Agent Operations Layer
agent.can4: Apply rate limits and firewall policies
agent.cant1: Modify consensus rules or state transition determinism
agent.cant2: Inject unverifiable 'AI decisions' into on-chain execution
agent.note: COC maintains verifiability by keeping AI agents strictly in the operations layer

technology.title: Technical Architecture
technology.subtitle: Deep dive into COC's four-layer architecture design and core algorithms

layer1.title: Execution Layer
layer1.subtitle: EVM Runtime
features: Maintain world state (LevelDB + Merkle Patricia Trie)
layer1.note: EVM is the runtime environment, not the decentralization mechanism itself

layer2.title: Consensus Layer
layer2.subtitle: Pluggable Design
features: Future: can integrate BFT, PoA, etc.
layer2.note: COC's incentive model does not rely on PoS, can coexist with various consensus mechanisms

layer3.title: PoSe Service Layer
layer3.subtitle: Core Innovation
layer3.note: This is the core layer that differentiates COC from traditional PoW/PoS

layer4.title: AI Agent Operations Layer
layer4.subtitle: OpenClaw-grade Automation
layer4.note: Agents strictly isolated, do not interfere with consensus logic or state transitions

step1.title: Challenge Generation
step1.description: Challenger selects target nodes based on VRF randomness, generates challenge messages
details: challenge_id = keccak(epoch_id || node_id || type || nonce || challenger_id)
Contains query specs (U: RPC method, S: chunk_id, R: route_tag)

step2.title: Node Response
step2.description: Node receives challenge, generates response and signs within timeout
details: U challenge: execute RPC query, return result (2.5s timeout)
S challenge: provide storage proof (Merkle path, 6s timeout)

step3.title: Receipt Verification
step3.description: Aggregator or Verifier validates receipt validity
details: Verify response content (U: re-computable, S: Merkle verification)

step4.title: On-chain Submission
step4.description: Aggregator submits receipt Merkle tree root on-chain

step5.title: Score Settlement
step5.description: After epoch ends, calculate node scores based on pass rates and distribute rewards
details: Apply diminishing returns and soft caps

uptimeScore.title: Uptime Score
uptimeScore.rationale: Latency factor only 15% weight, avoids bandwidth arms race

storageScore.title: Storage Score (SN)
storageScore.rationale: Square root function ensures diminishing returns on storage capacity, prevents whale monopoly

blockTime.title: Block Time
blockTime.description: Target block interval, actual value depends on consensus layer configuration

storage.title: Storage Requirement
storage.description: Diminishing returns cap for SN nodes, FN can be lower

bandwidth.title: Bandwidth Requirement
bandwidth.description: Latency only 15% weight, regular home networks can participate

frequency.title: Challenge Frequency
frequency.description: FN nodes receive about 6 U challenges per epoch

threshold.title: Pass Threshold
threshold.description: Below threshold loses eligibility for corresponding bucket reward

explorer.description: View complete block and transaction details

startNode.description: Join COC network, run your own node

roadmap.title: Development Roadmap
roadmap.subtitle: COC project development history and future plans

v0_1.title: PoSe Contracts + Node Registration + Challenge Mechanism
items: PoSe management contract (registration, batch submission, disputes, slashing)
Node registration interface (node_id, pubkey, flags, commitments)

v0_2.title: Off-chain Aggregation + On-chain Batch Submission + Dispute Window

cycles.desc: Contract call interface + WebSocket BigInt serialization fix
txpool RPC methods + mempool explorer page
Fixed TxHistory table structure, added gas column
Chain statistics page (block activity, TPS, Gas visualization)
Debug trace improvements, event log support
Contract list page, scan recent deployments

runNode.title: Run Local Node
runNode.code:
cd node
npm install
npm start

deployContract.title: Deploy Contracts
deployContract.code:
cd contracts
npm install
npm run compile
npm run deploy:local

launchExplorer.title: Launch Explorer
launchExplorer.code:
cd explorer
npm install
npm run dev
